questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You manage the Microsoft Teams environment for a ExamTopics company. You configure direct routing telephony.
A user reports that the dial pad does not appear in their Teams app.
You need to resolve the issue. You assign the user a phone system license.
What should you do? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Ref: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/direct-routing-border-controllers - Microsoft only supports Phone System with Direct Routing when used with certified devices. In case of issues, you must contact your SBC vendor's customer support first.

Firmware versions that are higher than what is documented are supported as long as the major.minor version is the same.

A is the old version of the firmware. Answer B is the updated version.

I would say its B. ASEA - Azure region for Signaling is the data center that was used for signaling for both bypass and non-bypass calls. 

SIP Proxy for Asia (location) - Traffic manager FQDN sip-du-a-asea.pstnhub.microsoft.com â€“ 52.114.7.24 - As per the question, the location is Australia

Answer C - USEA = SIP Proxy is America
Answer D - ASSE - Azure Media Services broadcast-quality video streaming, enhance accessibility and distribution, analyze content

questions.question_text:
An administrator for a tenant in Australia assigns direct routing numbers to cloud auto-attendants (AA).
Whenever a call is received by an AA, there is a delay of more than 10 seconds before the welcome message plays.
You need to review the SBC logs to determine the cause of the delay.
Which log entry identifies the cause of the delay?

A company has their headquarters in France and stores all over the world. The ExamTopics company wants to organize live events in China.
Meeting organizers in China cannot create Microsoft Teams live events.
You need to determine the cause of the issue.
What are two possible causes? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
Live events relies on Azure CDN services, which may be unavailable in some countries. As an administrator, you might need to set up a VPN in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations to connect to your corporate network for these apps to work seamlessly. Once that's complete, people in your organization can schedule and attend live events.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/teams-live-events/plan-for-teams-live-events

B and C are correct answers. Event team members and attendees will not be able to use Teams live events because Azure CDN is not accessible in China. 

A workaround is to use a company VPN connection, which gets the client connected to CDN via the customer's corporate network.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/stream/live-event-troubleshooting - article date 25-02-22

I would go for A and C
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-live-events/plan-for-teams-live-events

"Maximum number of concurrent live events per Microsoft 365 or Office 365 organization 15"
"China: Event team members and attendees will not be able to use Teams live events because Azure CDN is not accessible in China. A workaround is to use a company VPN connection, which gets the client connected to CDN via the customer's corporate network."

comments.content: Then wouldn't the answers be B and C? The question doesn't mention that there are ongoing live events. This ("China: Event team members and attendees will not be able to use Teams live events because Azure CDN is not accessible in China. A workaround is to use a company VPN connection, which gets the client connected to CDN via the customer's corporate network.") pretty much answers B and C.

choices.C: The company has not configured a VPN for connecting to the corporate network.
choices.A: The company already has 15 Terms live events running concurrently.
choices.B: Azure content delivery networks (CDNs) are not accessible in China.
choices.D: Users do not have valid Advanced Communication licenses.

discussion.content:
Correct
The teachers license is STANDARDWOFFPACK_FACULTY (aka Office 365 A1 for faculty) 

Office Support and Microsoft docs states that a Office 365 Enterprise E1, E3, or E5 license or a Office 365 A3 or A5 license is required to organize a live event.
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/get-started-with-microsoft-teams-live-events-d077fec2-a058-483e-9ab5-1494afda578a
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-live-events/plan-for-teams-live-events

Microsoft docs states that one of the following licenses is required in order to produce or present a live event:
A Microsoft or Office 365 Enterprise E1, E3 or E5 license, [or] a Microsoft or Office 365 Education A1, A3 or A5 license. 

So the teacher has sufficient license to produce and present the live event with the A1 license but cant organize/schedule it which is why the answer is correct.

Is the licensing sufficient for the teachers to schedule live events = YES - To produce or present: A Microsoft or Office 365 Enterprise E1, E3 or E5 license, [or] a Microsoft or Office 365 Education A1, A3 or A5 license. "STANDARDWOFFPACK_FACULTY" = "Office 365 Education E1 for Faculty"

Is a network trace needed to troubleshoot the issue = NO - This is not required as the Live Event has not happened. 

Does the teacher's policy allow for the creation of Live events? = YES - The teacher does have the policy to create the Live Event because in the diagram the policy is set to True. From Microsoft, Live event scheduling in Teams enabled (The TeamsMeetingBroadcastPolicy -AllowBroadcastScheduling parameter = True).

For me itS N/N/N.
Private meeting scheduling is off, which should be ON as prereq to Live Event
Here are the all SKUs for Education license plans: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/sku-reference-edu

Correct~

To organize: A Microsoft or Office 365 Enterprise E1, E3, or E5 license, [or] a Microsoft or Office 365 Education A3 or A5 license.

To produce or present: A Microsoft or Office 365 Enterprise E1, E3 or E5 license, [or] a Microsoft or Office 365 Education A1, A3 or A5 license. The exception to this requirement is guest users can present without a license if the other criteria for guest users is met.

Honestly, the questions asked here aren't straight forward.

Is the licensing sufficient for the teachers to schedule live events?
 -STANDARDWOFFPACK-FACULTY, I preseume it's "Office 365 A1" which offers Teams Services. Hence my answer for this would be "Yes"

Is a network trace needed to troubleshoot the issue?
- There is no requirement for network trace for a feature / scheduling issue. Hence my answer for this would be "No"

Does the teacher's policy allow for the creation of live events?
- The policies displayed here are "Meeting Policies" and NOT "Live events policies". Assuming there is no custom "Live events policies" assigned to this teacher I would say my answer for this would be "Yes"

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A company uses Microsoft Teams. You delete a user.
You suspect that the deleted user is listed as the owner of a team. You attempt to connect to the Teams PowerShell module to investigate the issue. The following message appears:
Connect-MicrosoftTeam : The term 'Connect-MicrosoftTeam' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program. Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.
You need to resolve the error and confirm whether the deleted user is still owner of the team.
Which four PowerShell commands should you use to develop the solution? To answer, move the appropriate commands from the list of commands to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//
